text: we need a different approach all of us
to global affairs and Iran is certainly
ready to play that new role with the
talks between the United States and
Europeans on one side and Iran on the
other starting up again in Geneva this
week it raises the interesting question
how did we get to this point and this is
going anywhere it is a disgrace that we
well we got here because President Obama
made a promise in the 2008 presidential
campaign that he was willing to talk to
his adversaries we need to talk to Iran
and Syria it was four and a half years
of fundamental silence periodic efforts
to get negotiations going they all led
nowhere but with the election now of
President rouhani a former nuclear
negotiator in Iran those talks have
started up a new a combination of
pressures has made this negotiation
possible the sanctions have severely cut
into Iran's oil exports and its export
earnings and the election of President
rouhani was viewed by the Iranian
clerics as a sign that popular
discontent mostly from the sanctions
meant that they had to do something and
do it quickly but the fact of the matter
is the negotiation will be far more
complex today then it would have been in
2009 when President Obama first proposed
it I want you the people and leaders of
Iran to understand the future that we
see the Iranians have had more than a
four-fold increase in their production
of uranium the fuel for nuclear weapons
in that time period and that means that
their ability to dash for a bomb if they
ever made that decision is now a lot
easier than it would have been back then
so part of the objective of the American
negotiating team is to roll back some of
the Iranian production capability
ultimately to reach a deal here there
needs to be three agreements there's an
international one between the US and its
allies and the Iranian negotiators
there's got to be a separate agreement
inside Iran between the moderates and
those who tried to defend the nuclear
program including the Iranian military
and the clerics and finally there's got
to be an agreement inside the United
States between the Obama administration
and a congress has been very eager to
vote for sanctions against Iran but may
be very reluctant to back them off which
would be of course the American side of
the deal
